text.headline: Putin's war on civilians
text.text: Each dot represents an attack on civilians or civilian infrastructure verified by the Centre for Information Resilience.

media.caption: Aerial view of Mariupol

text.headline: Mariupol
text.text: More than 2,500 people have been killed, according to Ukrainian authorities.

media.caption: The aftermath of a deadly attack on a Mariupol hospital

text.text: Russia's bombing of a maternity hospital in the city provoked international outrage, with the EU describing the attack as a war crime. Russia has admitted bombing the hospital, but claims it was being used as a military base and that the casualties were staged. According to Ukrainian authorities, three people were killed - including a child.

media.caption: Damaged buildings in central Mariupol, including Pryazovskyi State Technical University

text.text: The Russian-speaking city has been under siege by the Russian military since 24 February.

media.caption: Damaged buildings in central Mariupol

text.text: Parts of the city centre have been reduced to rubble by artillery and air strikes.

media.caption: Smoke rises above residential buildings in Mariupol

text.text: Ukrainian officials have accused Russian forces of targeting residential areas and shelling agreed evacuation corridors.

media.caption: Remains of Kherson shopping centre after Russian shelling

text.headline: Kherson
text.text: The city of Kherson fell to Russian forces after six days of fighting, also with heavy civilian casualties.

media.caption: Civilian ambulance allegedly targeted by Russian soldiers.

text.text: As in Mariupol, Russian forces are alleged to have targeted civilian healthcare infrastructure. A Russian attack on this civilian ambulance killed two people, Ukrainian authorities say.

media.caption: Hospital bombed in Izyum

text.headline: Izyum
text.text: This psychiatric hospital in the eastern town of Izyum was also hit. Local government officials described the bombing as a "war crime against civilians".

media.caption: Consequences of shelling in Izyum, Kharkiv region

text.text: Large parts of the town have been destroyed, including residential areas.

media.caption: Smoke rises above residential buildings in Kharkiv.

text.headline: Kharkiv
text.text: Nearby lies Kharkiv, which has seen some of the most intense fighting of the war so far.

media.caption: Building on fire in Kharkiv, which Ukrainian lawmakers have said is a hospital.

text.text: Ukrainian lawmakers have said Russia was behind this attack on one of the city's hospitals.

media.caption: Kindergarten 354, Kharkiv.

text.text: Russia has been accused of targeting not only hospitals, but also schools. Kharkiv's mayor has accused Russian forces of destroying 48 schools in the city.

media.caption: Apartment building destroyed by missile strike.

text.text: This block of flats nearby has been almost entirely destroyed by Russian missiles.

media.caption: School 17, Kharkiv.

text.text: Russian shelling left a gaping hole in the side of this school in the east of the city.

media.caption: Rocket motor for cluster munition embedded on a playground in Kharkiv.

text.text: Cluster munitions, which release dozens of explosive charges over a wide area, have also been used against residential areas.

media.caption: School 134, Kharkiv.

text.text: This school has been almost entirely destroyed, after a fire allegedly caused by Russian forces.

media.caption: Aftermath of Russian bombardment of Kharkiv.

text.text: Ukrainian president Vlodomyr Zelensky has said that Russia's attacks on Kharkiv are "war crimes".

media.caption: Shell crater and damage to surrounding buildings.

text.headline: Okhtyrka
text.text: To the north-east lies the small city of Okhtyrka, which has also faced heavy bombardment by Russian forces.

media.caption: Civilian casualties at primary school.

text.text: A cluster bomb attack on the town's primary school killed a child and two adults, according to Amnesty International.

media.caption: Shell crater and damage to surrounding buildings.

text.text: The city has seen heavy fighting in recent weeks, including the use of what Ukrainian authorities have alleged was a Russian vacuum bomb.

media.caption: Playground hit by a munition in Chernihiv.

text.headline: Chernihiv
text.text: Near the border with Belarus, Chernihiv has also faced devastating bombardment from Russian forces - including an attack on this playground.

media.caption: Youth center destroyed in Chernihiv.

text.text: Nearby, a youth centre was also destroyed.

media.caption: Damaged civilian residential infrastructure after Russian bombing in Chernihiv

text.text: A Russian airstrike on a bread queue in the city killed 47 people on 3 March, according to Amnesty International.

media.caption: Aftermath of strikes on civilian buildings

text.text: Amnesty has said the attack, which it believes was conducted with unguided bombs, should be investigated as a possible war crime.

media.caption: Aftermath of Russian shelling of residential area in Bordyanka

text.headline: Borodyanka
text.text: The small town of Borodyanka, north east of Kyiv, has faced similarly indiscriminate bombardment.

media.caption: Tank firing at residential building

text.text: Locals have reported that Russian tanks fired their guns into the town's supermarket. This video shows a tank shooting directly at the cameraman, who was in a municipal building.

media.caption: Reuters Drone footage of the damage sustained in Borodyanka.

text.text: Much of the town has been reduced to rubble.

media.caption: Damaged residential buildings

text.headline: Bucha
text.text: As Russian forces advance towards Kyiv, the capital's outer suburbs have suffered from increasingly intense fighting.

media.caption: Civilian casualties after russian strike

text.headline: Irpin
text.text: As in Mariupol, Russian forces have been accused of targeting evacuees. This strike, which was witnessed by a New York Times reporter, killed a family of four.

media.caption: Buildings destroyed in Irpin.

text.text: Heavy shelling has destroyed residential buildings in the town.

media.caption: Civilian building hit by shell in Kyiv.

text.headline: Kyiv
text.text: Civilians in Ukraine's capital have not been spared violence. This block of flats was hit by a Russian artillery strike.

media.caption: Tank driving over civilian car

text.text: Early incursions by Russian forces saw indiscriminate attacks against civilians, such as this car run over by a tank.

media.caption: Damaged residential area in Irpin

text.text: Parts of the city have been largely destroyed.
